lines.line: Hello again! What can I do for you?
As a matter of fact, I do...
I have a client from the mainland who's interested in learning a bit more about Kourend.
They've asked me to gather some information on the five cities for them.
I was just going to do it myself, but as you're quite new around here, this might be a good opportunity for you to get to know the kingdom a bit better.
So what do you say?
Take this scroll.
My client is interested in the hierarchy and general social organisation of Great Kourend.
Especially when it comes to how it differs from the mainland.
That scroll is special. When written on with a particular type of quill, my client will see what you're writing without anything being seen on the scroll itself.
Not exactly... My client simply wishes to keep their 'knowledge gathering' on the down low.
There's many a man and woman who could give you the information you need, but general store owners in each city will likely be your best bet.
They should know enough about their cities, and always seem up for a chat.
Simply touching a normal feather onto the paper should synchronise their magical ability to work together.
You don't need any ink.
See you soon.
Very well. Do come back if you wish to help out my client.
What do you require, traveller? I deal in many things.
This city holds knowledge many would deem unsafe to share.
Why should I be so trusting to you?
Someone willing to share knowledge of our great city to many others?
Very well, then. The rest of the world could certainly do with learning about our great library.
Arceuus is filled with literary and magical scholars.
Lead by the great Trobin Arceuus.
As a leader, he assists in pushing the limit of our knowledge surrounding magical abilities, souls and the crafting of runic energy.
He cares not for petty control, focusing instead on the expansion of knowledge within Great Kourend.
Our library is something to behold, but the millennia of knowledge found there; runic, magical and religious, are but small findings compared to the power of the Dark Altar.
Through its power, we have great knowledge on life and death.
This knowledge could be yours as well.
What is the matter, journalist?
Very well. As mentioned, rewards on offer within our city are priceless.
The sharing of our magical research is but child's play compared to the knowledge of Blood and Soul runecrafting.
You're welcome. Spread the word of this great city with the new knowledge you have gained, and perhaps be more careful with how you hold your scroll in the future...
Hello, I'm Horace. Welcome to my shop. Would you like to buy or sell something?
Well, well my friend! I've lived in this great and glorious city all of my life.
I'd be happy to share with you anything you'd like to know!
Hosidius is filled with keen and skilled farmers alike!
Lead by the incredibly efficient Kandur Hosidius, his intelligent resourcefulness ensures optimal agricultural production.
Our fields stretch as far as the eye can see.
With incredible teamwork and group efforts, the ability to provide Great Kourend's people with food and herbal supplies is quite literally the fruits of our labour.
Our personal kitchens and farming patches are lovely.
That being said, the real gems of Hosidius are the vinery and Tithe farm.
Both are world class!
Anytime, friend! Feel free to pop along if you ever need any wares!
Can I help you, human?
Why I'd be happy to have a chat!
I do enjoy talking about this great city of ours.
Lovakengj is filled with incredibly skilled blacksmiths.
Under the leadership of Vulcana Lovakengj, our intelligent material saving skills make us the finest blacksmiths in the land.
Armours, weaponry, tools and structures - our city supplies Kourend with all of these to the finest standards known to Dwarf and Human alike.
Well creating dynamite and mining in the sulphur mine isn't a pretty job, but someone has to do it!
We also make the armour worn by the very soldiers of the Shayzien Army here, not to mention the Blast Mine.
The rewards able to be reaped in our city are nothing to be scoffed at!
Anytime! Come back soon!
A great adventurer, from afar? How may I help with my repertoire?
If it's Piscarilius information you seek, it's in my brain that you must peek!
If there's one thing, that I do best, it's waiting patiently, for my guests!
Within Port Piscarilius, you'll find, great fisherman, traders, pirates and I.
All lead, by our ruthless leader, Shauna Piscarilius, none yet to supersede her.
No surprise if you meet her, her tactics are ruthless.
Her demeanour renders, all pirates toothless.
Our great shore and trading, have treasures to be found, providing export and fish, in quantities abound.
Our shore is brimming, with gold from the sea, the most loyal of our people, are handed the key.
We'll let you stand on our shores and collect, the great anglerfish; other only... covet?
Listen here pal, you don't mess with people in Port Piscarilius.
Do you want happy rhyming Leenz, or angry, gruff and pain-inflicting Leenz?
Anytime, my adventuring friend, enjoy your time in Great Kourend!
What're yer looking for, me luv'?
Well I could give you some info if that's all yer wantin'.
Gets lonely in 'ere while me mates are out there fightin' the good war!
Well ye canne remember everything I 'ave to say about this wee 'ouse without that, can you?
Come back when yer 'ead's not all fried!
Phwoar, what don' we do? This place is filled with officers and the like.
Lead by our rig'rous leader Shiro Shayzien, 'e ensures ultimate justice and safety for the entirety of Great Kourend.
Our soldiers fight off the constant threat of the lizardman, while our 'ighly trained medics 'eal them from battle.
Strict in combat trainin' and discipline. Law, order and defence.
These are the words we live by!
It ain't all pretty 'ere, but if you 'elp our soldiers and tackle some organised crime...
You'll soon find that the spoils o' war are grand.
That's alright petal, you go'un and have fun.
Yes, I heard it too... they mentioned that your task was complete.
Let me take those items off your hands.
If it makes you feel any better, my client sends their apologies.
It wasn't intentional. Needless to say, something you said provoked emotion...
Namely...
The Dark Altar...
Well that's just the thing.
My client is pleased you found such information.
Tell me... Would you be willing to do one last thing for them?
I'm certainly glad you're able to assist once again.
My client will be most pleased.
My client requires... another simple task.
They assure me that it will be the last.
Take this orb. You must activate it beside the Dark Altar, north of Arceuus.
It's best you don't.
What are you talking about?
I haven't spoken with you since bringing you to Kourend, I have no idea what you're on ab--
ARGH!
Indeed you have.
You have done well. For that, you have my thanks.
You need not fear for him. I will ensure no harm comes his way.
As for who I am... Well, that is of no importance.
Knowledge can be a curse.
Sometimes, it is better to remain unaware.
Now, time to release this mind back to consciousness...
Don't worry, I'll make sure he rewards you.
After all, you've been very useful to me...

characters.name: Horace
characters.description: Middle-aged male, warm British accent, cheerful and welcoming tone. A friendly shopkeeper who takes great pride in Hosidius and its agricultural achievements, speaking enthusiastically about farming and community.

characters.name: Jennifer
characters.description: Middle-aged female, strong Scottish accent, rough and down-to-earth tone. A no-nonsense shopkeeper in the military district of Shayzien who speaks with working-class charm and soldier's pragmatism.

characters.name: Leenz
characters.description: Adult female, theatrical British accent, whimsical and playful tone that shifts to threatening when challenged. A quirky shopkeeper in Port Piscarilius who speaks almost entirely in rhyme but reveals a dangerous edge when provoked.

characters.name: Munty
characters.description: Adult male dwarf, deep gruff Scottish accent, proud and industrious tone. A dwarven shopkeeper in Lovakengj who speaks with characteristic dwarven pride about smithing, mining, and craftsmanship.

characters.name: Regath
characters.description: Older male, refined British accent, cautious and intellectual tone with underlying arrogance. A mysterious shopkeeper in the magical city of Arceuus who guards knowledge carefully but takes pride in sharing the city's scholarly achievements.

characters.name: Veos
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, friendly and approachable tone with underlying mystery. An experienced treasure hunter from Great Kourend who speaks with confidence and a hint of secrecy about his true motives.

characters.name: Veos' Client
characters.description: Ancient male, deep echoing British accent, calm and menacing tone with subtle malevolence. A mysterious entity possessing Veos who speaks with cryptic wisdom and an unsettling sense of power, revealed to be the exiled tyrant Xeric.
